I also highly recommend this place for their $7 cocktails...get the lychee martini, obviously. I'd go back and try out the Bi Bim Bop bowls since that's apparently really good here.
author: Chloé M.

description: In the city where decent Korean restaurants are scarce (especially in downtown), this place impressed me. Been eyeing on this restaurant for a while but it always looked quite empty so I didn't try it out early but I'm glad I finally did. We ordered spicy octopus with noodles and yukgaejang (spicy beef soup). Both dishes hit the spot! It was packed today and we had to wait good 20min but was worth it.
author: Bomin K.

description:
Food is traditionally what gives me the incessant need to give y'all a review, and what I found at 707 was a great catch. I think people are often super stoked to give a 5 star rating, but as I've said in previous posts, unless you're being offered a angelic foot rub on a magic carpet ride, 4 stars is as good as you're going to get from me until otherwise proven.

I walked into 707 and straight away was greeted and seated. Check+. The waitress was very quick and curt. I ordered hot tea and was grabbed at the shoulder 10 minutes later with the waitress abruptly saying, "Excuse me sir, your tea is just finished boiling and will be right out". I nodded in a quite startled response, "thank you" and carried on writing in my journal. It's not that usual that I come in and dine alone, but I was seated at a modest two-seater table while Korean pop music videos were projected on a large stone wall mesmerizing some of the other seemingly cyborg guests rambling on about their next hookup that couldn't speak Cantonese very well and continued to discredit the civilized nature of people from Hong Kong...the kinds of people in the world, truly, are astounding.

My tea arrived and order taken: I asked the waitress for the chicken skewer appetizer and the Soon Doo Bu soup with kim chi. While the projections banged on with glitzy Korean pop, food began to arrived by way of several dishes: (1) a small square plate with pineapple topped chicken skewers (three of them) over a small bed of white cabbage. Delicious! (2) a long rectangular dish, very fancy (check+), with five different kim chi vegetables, including broccoli, mung beans, yellow peppers, spicy cabbage, and braised tofu. Delicious again! (3) a small dish with an egg. "Um waitress?" Gone - before I had a chance to ask: damn she's just too fast and abrupt! (4) A bowl of rice. (5) Just then, the soup arrived and what a smell. The liquid was still boiling. I let it cool for awhile, and what I fool I am for that idea. Next, I cracked the egg, and would you believe it? The egg was still raw. Apparently, I'm new at this Korean cuisine, because no one informed me whatsoever. I figured it must've been for when the soup came out boiling, for it would've cooked the egg surely! I poured the contents into the soup and began to stir until all of the egg was fully cooked.

By meal's end, I was fully satisfied. The waitress and waiter continued to clear my table as necessary, checked in on me, and were very polite. My only qualm was wanting to tell the waitress to please slow down. So if you go here, and you suspect the same lightening speed, ask her to slow down!
author: Gio M.

description: Horrible, never come back. Waitress worked alone on weekdays, even it had have only few costumer kitchen and waitress got my food wrong one and brought not the one what I asked for. Eggs were missing, put meat in the soup when I asked for vegetarian, and uncooked. We couldn't finish the meal at all. I've heard good review about this place but why??
author: May Y.

description:
This place is really 3.5 stars. I went back because of the delicious pigs feet dish (that sure is delicious and probably the best dish there and frankly what will bring me back again). Everything else was good, the service seems to be pleasant, and it's your to be expected Korean joint. 

The only gripe is that their free appetizers were anemic one biters that they expect to be shared by 4 ppl... when you come to a Korean restaurant the least you expect to get is lots of diff tasty kim chi dishes before your meal, not the case here... seems rather cheap of them... and frankly I took out 0.5-1 star because of this.

Other than the pigs feet, we had the tofu kim chi soup - good, omu rice - blah (perhaps it's because I've had really good versions of this so the taste was not ketchupy and up to par enough and I was a little disappointed that it didn't bring me back to the days in Asia where I hung out with my Korean friends and did nothing but eat and drink sochu all night. Okay so I had outsized expectations on a simple dish and it didn't live up to the nostalgic memories as hardly anything ever does), kim chi fried rice - much better, and seafood scallion pancake (good but very greasy).

All in all, decent Korean place to hang with friends and eat & drink till u can't anymore.
author: Alice W.

description: DELICIOUS! This was my first time having Korean food and I did'nt know i was missing out on such great food! I ordered the Soft Tofu Soup with Kimchi and it was spicy and good! I was recommended this dish from my Korean friend and I am so glad I listened! It was amazing and I am going to be back and try it again!
author: Brittini S.

description: It was good but the kpop videos they were playing were way too provocative and just inappropriate. Maybe all kpop videos are like that? Not sure. I felt uncomfortable.
author: Olive Y.

description: Came here because my boss took me out for my birthday lunch. Their seafood pancake and tofu soup were my favorite! Coworker wanted to try their pig feet but it was too much! Will be back to try their soju!
author: Vanessa Y.

description: This restaurant gets 4 stars only because of the food. I came here with my family   is yesterday, and we were concerned about their service cause it pretty much sucked. the only had two people working. One was working as the server, host, and cashier while another person was a lone ranger in the kitchen. One person in the kitchen isn't the best idea for a restaurant that is always filled with tourists. Anyways, they had amazing food that made us wanting more.
author: Devin P.

description: Poor service. Waited over 1 hour and absolutely no acknowledgement from any of the staff. We were finally seated and the food was NOT worth the wait. The service did not improve after we sat down either. I ordered the  seafood soon dooboo and it was spicy without much actual flavor. Would not return nor recommend.
author: Louise O.

description: Save your money. Our party accidentally overpaid by $20. By the time we realized our error and confronted the server, the money was gone and off the books. We've been here a few times, often because it was open late, but ethics matter more than convenience. I won't be coming back.
author: Dan C.

description:
Definitely one of my new favorite Korean restaurant. They serve a lot of dishes that can't be found elsewhere in the city.

I been there around 4 times with friends, we always had a great time.
It's best to go as a group or at least 2 ppl, so y'all can share different dishes.
I highly recommend "bu dae ji gae" a spicy base soup for 2, as in hotpot style.

The atmosphere is great and friendly service. 
"I AM GOING BACK"
author: Ray D.

description:
Good food. Good atmosphere.  Friendly servers. New korean spot in downtown!!
I've been here couple times. Tried gam ja tang, kimchi fried rice, and soft tofu soup. Price of food is very reasonable (starter $5~10, main $10~15, some are over $20 which are big portion of soups). I will definitely be back to try other dishes.
author: Jay R.

description: Took a party of four here and had a great dinner.  We had bulgogi, japchae (glass noddles with pork and kimchi), chicken wings, dumplings, and fried rice, with some soju.  It was all great!  Very flavorful and spicy without being overwhelming. Service was prompt and it was a happening spot on a Saturday night.  Not overpriced at all.  Will be a return customer.
author: Jon A.

description:
YUM!
As a Korean who eats Korean food and was raised off of traditional Korean food from her mother, I approve! I've been to JinMi as well. In comparison, this place seems more youthful and the flavors are a bit more hip and Americanized, whereas JinMi is more of the traditional mom made homecooked food which I prefer. But nonetheless 707 is good!

We ordered galbi, yang nyum tong dak (seasoned chicken wings), and beef soondooboo. Everything was great. The galbi was the best though. It might have been slightly too sweet but it was delicious. The soup and chicken were good but spicy. If you normally eat Korean food, it's the good kinda kick in your mouth spice. If not, you're going to be drinking glasses of water. I've had better chicken back in DC but it was still good. The soup was good but a bit over seasoned. This soup in particular is a more clean soup but there was just a lot of seasoning put into it.

But all in all it was delicious!
The serving sizes were great! But they don't give that many side dishes. And their side dishes are definitely not memorable. I always think you can judge a Korean restaurant based on the side dishes. So four stars it is.

(Also it may look dark and closed from the door but their interior is just dim so don't be afraid to walk in!)
author: S H.

description: I used to live in LA and I miss the korean food since returning to San Francisco. I stopped by here on a whim and it was a good choice. They had pretty good Kimchi jjigae, and k-pop projected on the walls. Side dishes came quickly and were good. Service was prompt and with a smile. I'll come back when I'm in the area!
author: Kenan A.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Friday with a friend and it was pretty empty. And by empty, I mean empty. We were the only customers in the restaurant.

The food was pretty dang good. If I remember correctly, we ordered - Seafood Pancake, Corn Cheese, and some soup with ramen that I forgot the name of.

All that was for 2 people and boy was that too much food. They offer a tasty selection of banchan as well which you can ask refills for. 

Service is decent. They refilled our glasses without asking and checked up on us quite often. 

Thumbs up!
author: Jessica C.

description: 707 is a decent Korean restaurant. They met all of the standards, but didn't have anything extra. The beef bulgogi was very well-seasoned and tender.  My rice bowl with spicy pork was also tasty, but the pork was a bit fatty.  They did not have pickled cucumbers or Korean potatoes, which are my 2 favorite sides. The beef dimpling soup was average. The restaurant was a good size and full. Yet there were only 2 wait people. They were running with their heads cut off. The girl was a bit clumsy and spilled things and ran into chairs and table.  We had the guy. He was pretty good, but too busy for his own good.
author: Trang N.

description: Great cozy place to eat korean food in san francisco around the downtown area. The employees are always alert and ready to refill water or ask if you need help ordering. They also play kpop music on a big wall which is sort of entertaining. The male waiter we had there on friday was super nice and so quick in sitting us down and taking our orders that it didnt take long for our food to arrive. The side dishes are a plus!
author: Benjamin T.

description: If you are Korean, you know any Korean joint is only as good as the cook. And in many cases, it's just 2-3 people that run the 'Soon Jib'  at any given night. I stumbled in tipsy last night to a nice surprise. It was Park Ahjooma in the kitchen! Best known for feeding countless UCB students and East Bay kids for years at Berkeley's Koko's on Telegraph. And boy, she does Soon Jib food right. These dishes have no truffles, or caviar -  instead, the perfect amount of MSG. You know, makes you more thirsty to drink more. Perfect.
author: Deevie K.

description: We only get takeout from here, so I can't comment on the dine-in experience. But, the food we pick up is so good. Their spicy fried chicken wings are to die for, seriously. They will be my go-to wings for football nights or just I-need-delicious-wings nights from now on. They are a bit pricey, closer to $1 a wing than 10 cent buffalo wings that I am accustomed to, but, it's really worth it. They are crispy and spicy and big. I love the Jap Chae glass noodles from here, too. I will eventually try most everything on the menu, I'm sure it's all great. I am happy to have 707 Sutter in the neighborhood!
author: Halley S.

description: Great food, but service wasn't great, and the ambience is terrrrrrrrible. They play korean music videos-- which probably deters 90% of their possible consumer base. I felt like I needed to be a 19-year-old girl to feel comfortable in there. Regardless, I liked the food. Would probably only do take-out in the future.
author: Alison M.

description: Good portion, prob one of the best Korean food i have had in sf for a while. This place shall be my regular. I'll just leave it at that.
author: jasmin t.

description: Great Food, got Neck Bone Soup, Chicken Wings and Jap Chae. GF and I both loved the taste and portion. Owner is very nice as well as the waiters.  Parking is kind of hard depending what time you go but well worth the wait. Def give it a try, you don't have to wait hours in line like at Cocobang and has more space to sit and awesome food which is a place.
author: Kevin J.

description: Great place to spend time with good company.  Location is very convenient and staff is very attentive.  Definitely have to try their carbonated rice wine drink.  Food is great, can never go wrong with soondubu, ultimate comfort food.  WIll definitely go back.
author: Sharon C.

description: Awesome Korean food! It was my first time and I loved the chicken barbecue. I also liked the chapchae. Next time we'll order more things. The music videos were really amusing, especially since some of PSY's new (and really weird) stufd was playing. The restaurant was pretty busy and the food came by quickly. Only bad highlight of the night was that the server accidentally gave us the wrong food. We mistakenly took some of the other customer's beef before realizing and the server still gave that customer the same plate. He didn't offer to replace it until the customer spoke to him about it. Hopefully it was also that server's first night. Otherwise...this restaurant has sketchy hygiene standards.
author: Katsurina C.

description: We were in a group of around 20 people. We was a little drunk so the food tasted very good!! Edward the waiter was very friendly and gave us a very good service! But the short korean girl was like not happy with her work I guess so she was cold and not friendly at all. Over all the food was alright~ good enough if you are craving korean food!
author: Kim K.

description: My girls and I come here for drinks all the time because the service is great. On the plus side, if you know korean you get served faster.
author: Anthony R.

description: First time trying here, me and my girlfriend (she's Korean and she hated it) ordered corn cheese, beef soft tofu soup and bibim nang myun (spicy cold noodle) and it does NOT taste good. The soup doesn't even taste Korean and it's really salty. The cold noodles aw really saucy which was why it was also salty. The only thing that was good was the corn cheese ($6) which can be easily made at home. Their food is too pricy for it's taste! Don't come here!!
author: Francis C.

description: Trying to find parking for this place is horrendous. My sister and I must have circled for at least 30 minutes before we found parking in front of a coffee shop. The food is good and the service is pretty quick; not really attentive, but thats ok i guess. We ordered A LOT of food. If i recall correctly we had: fried chicken wings with spicy house sauce, tofu kimchi fried rice, jap chae, gal bi, and bbq chicken skewers. The food is good, but its really over priced. Not sure I would go back.
author: Karen A.

description: Really good home-style Korean dishes available here. Casserole dishes are great. Soju cocktails on point. Appetizers you can not go wrong with the seafood pancake, kimchi pancake, corn cheese, or spicy rice cake with or without ramen. K-pop videos are fun to watch and service is very friendly. Go take a gander and eat some legit grub.
author: Michelle N.

description: Love the food and the music!!! Not very expensive, but definitely one of the best Korean restaurants. Will come back.
author: Diana D.

description: Seldom have there been an occasion where I've enjoyed take-out so much. We ordered from the car as we drove through the financial district.  They told us 10 minutes!  To my surprise our dinner was waiting when we arrived.  Each dish was a delight.  The Spicy wings were oh so SPICY...they hurt so good!  The Spicy Pork Fried Rice was much more than NICE.  The glow of a bright morning sun was the greeting of the single sunny side up egg atop the rice dish.  Wonderful seasonings and aromas resembled taste that I recall from years past during my travels. The portions were most generous.  So much that we had half left over.  We made a lovely omelette the next morning and filled it with the rice dish.  Topped with Sarahi Aioli and chopped green onions...YUMMY.  I threw the leftover wings in a chicken stock with frozen veggies and Ramen noodles for a wonderful lunch soup!  Not only did they provide a wonderful late night dinner but a fabulous inspired us for a fabulous breakfast and lunch!  Hurray...we love this establishment.  Will be back!
author: Lisa P.

description:
great late night spot with actual good korean food. this place will do well since there aren't many good korean spots and especially not in downtown. 

seafood pancake: tasty as usual
tofu soup: delicious- could use a bit more tofu
seafood platter: also really good

will definitely come back when I need more korean fix. 

not to mention, the music videos are extremely entertaining
author: Janet Y.

description: Probably the best korean food in SF city area. Stews are really good, I recommend budaejigae and gamja tang. Meat dishes are pretty good too, as well as the chicken wings. Good for groups and drinking.
author: Jessica L.

description: The food here is awesome, but it makes my stomach hurt every time I eat here regardless of what I order. :(
author: Lilian K.

description: We came here for dinner and I was disappointed. The quality of BBQ beef was really bad and two big bones took up half of the portion. The side dishes were not freshly made either. The seafood pancake was tasty though.
author: Liu T.

description: Nice little restaurant that my husband and I tried because cocobang looked like there was going to be a long wait. Am I glad we decided to eat here instead. We got seated right away and the staff were friendly and fast. The restaurant is nice with a great atmosphere. I really enjoyed the kpop music videos playing and projected on a huge projector.  I had the gal bi and it was delicious. It was so tender and flavorful. Although, my husband said that their bibimbap was just okay, and their sides could've used a refill of bigger portion. I liked their strawberry soju cocktail also.
author: J L.

description: Close enough to Union Square for lunch, but not crowded at lunchtime.  I ordered one of the lunch specials, chicken bento box, for $8.
author: Mamie B.

description: Had seafood dol sot bi bim bap which was good.  Service is average.  Ban Chan was below average, dried out, felt like I was eating ban chan that was already served.  I'll probably come back again just to try the kimchi rice but I am pretty convinced there isn't a single decent korean restaurant in SF.
author: Teck L.

description: Food is pretty good (especially the seafood pancake). I'm not in love with the fact that they have k-pop videos projected onto the wall with the music at high volume.
author: Ivan M.

description: I usually get the Spicy Tofu Soup which is served with an egg and bowl of rice.  Very satisfying especially on a cold day.  Or for some people on a hot day too if you like the sweat to cool you down :) I have also gotten the Beef Dol Sot, which is also good.  The service is very friendly, but when it gets busy things slow down quite a bit.  I've only seen one server working at a time.  This is a new location though, so as things get busier hopefully they will get more help.  I would come more often if that was the case.  When I'm not in a rush though this place really hits the spot. If you have a full hour for lunch it's all good.
author: Charla M.

description: We were craving Korean and this place was open so we went in and were SURPRISED at how great it was! They have only been open for 3 months now.  You can get your Korean fashion fix from all the K. expats or art students and watch Korean music vids (dreeaaammy) on the large projector. The service was great, our waiter was like your insider friend who hooks you up with all the goods. The food is tasty and affordable - and they give you a complimentary sample tray of yummy Korean treats.  We'll be going back!
author: Moline D.

description: Trader Joes frozen shrimp fried rice is better, grilled chicken is actually fried and the service is awesome! Ambiance is also good but drink lots of alcohol and come really hungry if you want the food to taste good. Sober is not as a good of an experience :/
author: Armando M.

description:
Food was good- we ordered a tofu soup and bibimbap along with some soju. The side dishes come in a pretty small plate but our waiter refilled ours several times. Service was very friendly.

The ambiance was not for me though- I'd rather not eat in a dimly lit room while watching korean music videos.
author: Julia W.

description: We had a party 6 that arrive And sat quickly..arrival time was 10p.m.we literally waited 20 min. Before we got water and another 15 min. For the waiter. Once we ordered I was in disbelief the skimpy amount of kimchi condiments that were handed to us.. Though the food was good they did poorly on service. If I had 3 hands I would give this place 3 thumbs down. There's other Korean spots I would try and would not return here. You don't get a second chance to make a first impression
author: Moises S.

description: This is an authentic joint. Nothing fancy but it is not meant that way. The food is very good. I ordered bulgoki and soft tofu soup with Kim chi. Both were very good.
author: Alex G.

description: Great Korean food at reasonable prices. Nice decor and chill ambiance. Will come back again.
author: Eduardo R.

description: This place is a great addition to the neighborhood. I work across the street and tried the food last week and was pleasantly surprised. Try the Bi Bim Bop bowls!
author: Brandon D.

description: the best tofu soup i have tasted to date..very flexible, can make a lot of items vegetarian if needed.. excellent service, extra helpings of the pumpkin appetizer upon request (a must-have)..minus one star for the guy on the phone who said the wait was an hour plus (we got our table in 20 mins when we go there)..will definitely go back!
author: Sriganesh R.

description: My friend took me to this restaurant last week and I absolutely love it! I had a seafood pancake and it was so good, so ordered seafood soup and again, it was so good. Also, servers were so kind and beautiful! You guys should go!
author: Sil J.

description: Wanted to like this place, but the overworked servers just didn't do a good job.  With only 2 for the entire place, they seemed a bit overmatched. The Kim chi pancake and fried squid appetizer we ordered was excellent, the beef dumpling stew was mediocre at best.  The Korean Pop music videos projected on the wall was a nice touch.
author: Hapy M.

description: I'm korean and I've been in SF for like 2 weeks. I was craving so much for Korean food so I yelped and found this place. The owner here was really nice and kind. I ordered soft tofu soup and fried dumplings and they were exactly the korean style I expected. I luuuuuurved it!
author: Vivianne S.

description: Stopped by here a while back and thought it was very good. A nice spacious and NEW restaurant that opens late and serves all your favorite Korean dishes and soju! Similar to Cocobang and Playground but in a nice big space...
author: Denny C.

description: Delicious.  Loved it.  But beware - medium spicy is pretty darn spicy!
author: An J.

description:
Crappy tofu dish (no taste to it).  We had to be the cook and add flavor to it by adding lots of salt and Go Chu Jang sauce.  

The waitress was like a zombie with her almost zombie-like expressions while interacting with us.

The second dish, Rah Bok Gi (ramen + rice cake), was decent.

The only interesting thing that stood out about this place was the Korean music videos that played on a large blank wall of the store, although its quality was pretty low-resolution.  

I wouldn't come back to this place.
author: David O.

description:
I was really hoping to find a good Korean spot in San Francisco, but alas, I have been spoiled by Santa Clara for too long.

We ordered:
Galbi - Definitely on the burnt side. And it didn't have the little bones that add so much flavor to the dish
Bulgogi soup - Too salty, but otherwise ok

The banchan had tiny portions and was never re-filled. But it was not particularly tasty anyway.

Lastly, the service was awful. Even though the place was not busy, it took quite some time before we could order and even more time to get the waitress' attention to get the bill after we were long done. 

The only good thing I can say is that the place is spacious and there was no wait.
author: Jenny K.

description: I love 707, the girls that work here are super pretty, like Hyuna, and super nice! They make the best food, and I love their slushy drinks! Highly recommended for bar hoping munchy spot, or a fun date! They're the best place in the neighborhood, I'm so lucky to live across the street from them!
author: Erin H.

description: Super AWESOME! After drinks at a local bar, my friends took me here for a late night snack. I was diggin' the K pop vibe. Although my friend swears the food is mediocre (she's Korean), I beg to differ. It was a great change in pace compared to mundane New-American cuisine post drinking. Check it out!!!
author: Andrew H.

description: Good food, good vibe, good service! The projector playing Korean pop also contributes to this cool hip place.
author: Dexter L.

description: This is a nice korean Resturant , it has a lot of korean food that other korean Resturant doesn't have, especially the pig feet and the tofu kimchi. It's delicious. Highly recommended!
author: Kam L.

description: Great lunch menu with a reasonable price.  The dinner menu is kinda expensive and not too great. clean decor and service is ok.
author: Collin L.

description:
the glass noodle is so delicious, the skewers are also delicious.
it is the one of the best far east restaurant at that district.
author: Baris O.

description:
Torn between 3 and 4 stars, but this area isn't great for cheap and tasty options, and this place was cheap and tasty. Staff was attentive, the K-Pop videos projected on the wall were entertaining while waiting for food, and the tray of appetizers was tasty and fun to pick at. 

We ordered Bi Bim Bap and Kim Chi fried rice. The latter was very tasty, the former could have had a little more flavour. The side salad that came with the fried rice was a very basic side salad: leaves with too much dressing.
author: Jasmine H.

description: Amazing food and great service. Our waiter, Eddie, was one of the best servers I've had in the City. I think he must be the owner cuz he acts like a boss.
author: Eric H.

description:
i am so glad this place opened! before 707 sutter came around, cocobang had a monopoly on korean food in nob hill/tenderloin. while i LOVE cocobang, it is a such a small restaurant and the wait can be as long as 1 hour for a table. 

enter 707 sutter. the food is yummy but the place is MUCH MORE spacious. i had the bulgogi and the seafood pancake on two separate occasions and they made it really well! (i am really picky with my korean food and i liked 707 sutter's so you KNOW they know how to cook their korean dishes.) 

in other words, this restaurant will be seeing me more often :D
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description: Ok. I would go 2 stars for this restaurant because foods were not bad, but the service was bad. First, they DID NOT take my girlfriend and me to table like 5 mins even there are several seats available. Foods were late about 20-30 mins. I understand it, but they didnt give us spoons even we ordered soup and soup was right on my table. I think they should hire 1-2 more waiter/waitress.
author: Toby L.

description: Great food & service. Bi bim bap, kalbi & bulgogi were some of the best I've ever tried.
author: Peter A.

description:
NO!  No, no, no, no, no, and no.  Who is paying these reviewers?!  Y'all done let me down, dammit!

Food is tolerable at best, service was nice, but slow and inattentive, and the space/ambiance feels a bit too sterile for me.

I was really excited to try out the new neighborhood Korean joint and went in for dinner with a few friends.  We ordered the chicken skewers, jap chae, beef bibimbap, spicy fried chicken w/special sauce, and one of the beef and dumpling stews (forgot the name).  We were given banchan, but there were only FOUR dishes: tofu, pancake, bean sprouts, and regular kimchi.  Dafuq.

The skewers was a total joke.  $5 for maybe four bites of chicken/2 tiny skewers--hell to the naw.  While the meat was tender and tasted okay, it was definitely not worth it.  The best dish was the jap chae--full of flavor.  But don't get it twisted.  It was the best dish, not to be confused with a "delicious" dish, necessarily.  The bibimbap came out lukewarm and flavorwise, was just mediocre.  Maybe the soup was too spicy for me, but I could barely take down a small bowl of it.  The dumplings in the soup were good, but otherwise, it was just okay.  My party of four could not finish it; though the portion was large.  The fried chicken was especially unpalatable for me.  The "special sauce" tasted strange and very artificial.  It was thick, felt heavy taste-wise, and everyone agreed that the chicken needed a rinse.  And I'm not sure what the point of frying the chicken beforehand is--it's completely drenched with the sauce, making it soggy and messy.

I really wanted to like this place since it's new and close to home, but I highly doubt I'll be returning.
author: Dwigt K. S.

description: Maybe this place would have done it for me in my early 20s, but probably not.  Walked in to get take out and restaurant was extremely dark and the music was blaring. It was after 10pm, so I will give them that, but I would still not eat dinner here if this is their normal atmosphere.  Ordered the Kimchi Fried Rice to go...the servers were polite enough, and the food came out within a decent period of time.  But the dish itself is mediocre at best.  It's like hamburger helper made with rice and spice.  Not sure I can finish it it's so unsatisfying.  Not going back.  There's better Korean in San Francisco.
author: Julie I.

description: i like coming here.food and customer service is excellent. i rather come here then cocobang. i always get the dumpling soup.
author: Avery H.

description: Service was very good.  Food was okay.  Music was great if you are a Kpop lover.  It was funny watching PSY vomiting in the toliet (Hangover music video) while we were having fried chicken and beer.
author: Do Min J.

description: I love 707 Sutter! This place has the cutest servers who are patient with my terrible Korean! They have fun kpop videos up on the walls so that you can admire all of the Kpop stars (and let me tell you, they are quite beautiful!). The food is to die for! I've been bringing all of my friends and family here and will definitely be continuing to do so! Cheers 707 Sutter, you help this white girl get her fill of Korean!
author: Molly J.

description: I started eating at 707 when they opened.  It was really good and the staff was nice.  We went back last week.  The place smelled of sewage, and the staff never came to seat us.  We sat down at a table and were told to move. We left.
author: jud a.

description: The banchan was just vegetables that weren't good and their kimchi stews didn't have the heat or seasoning, ordered the Jakbol pigs feet and it was not what I expected.
author: N A.

description: weekend night getting kind of crowded but good food and friendly service its ok to wait.  if u dont want to spend money and complain about pricy then get the fuck out and go home eat your cup a noodle.
author: christian l.
